document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Ambrysus pulchellus Montandon species complex (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Naucoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Ambrysus pulchellus Montandon species complex (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Naucoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
A. buenoi Usinger 1946
: Univ. Kans. Sci. Bull., 31: 199–200 (original description).

A. buenoi : De Carlo 1950
, An. Soc. Cient. Argent., 150: 12 (species list, distribution).

A. buenoi : La Rivers 1951
, Univ. Calif. Publ. Entomol., 8: 310–312, 336 (supplemental description, habitus photo).

A. buenoi : La Rivers 1953a
, Univ. Kans. Sci. Bull., 35: 1284, 1287, 1309–1311 , 1342–1343 (key, excerpt from supplemental description, habitus photo).

A. buenoi : La Rivers 1953b
, Wasmann J. Biol., 11: 94 (morphology).

A. buenoi : La Rivers 1965
, Biol. Soc. Nev. Occas. Pap., 4: 5 (subgeneric assignment, distribution).

A. buenoi : La Rivers 1971
, Biol. Soc. Nev. Mem., 2: 66 (species list).

A. buenoi : Polhemus & Polhemus 1988
, Catal., p. 523 (species list).

A. buenoi : Sites 1991
, Southwest. Nat., 36: 357 (distribution).

A. buenoi : Davis 1996
, Southwest. Nat., 41: 3–7, 9, 14, 22, 24 (key, supplemental description, distribution, biology).

Diagnosis. ThIs spEcIEs cAN bE dIsTINGuIshEd fROm ThE OThER spEcIEs IN ThE cOmpLEx by ThE fEmALEs wITh ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of ThE SGP wITh A wIdE cENTRAL cONcAvITy ANd sLENdER pOsTEROLATERAL cORNERs pROjEcTEd pOsTERIORLy ( FIG. 1F ). ThE LATERAL mARGINs Of ThE SGP ARE NOT REfLExEd dORsALLy ANd ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of LATEROsTERNITE VI Is ALmOsT sTRAIGhT ( FIG. 1F ). MALEs Of
A. buenoi
pREsENT ThE AGP wITh A sLENdER bAsAL hALf ANd AN ALmOsT uNIfORmLy wIdENEd dIsTAL hALf ThAT TApERs TO AN ObTusE ApEx ( FIG. 1B ). ThE psEudOpARAmEREs hAvE A mEdIAL cONvExITy ANd TApER TO A pOINTEd ApIcAL LObE ( FIG. 1C ). ThE scuTELLum Is usuALLy A NEARLy uNIfORm LIGhT OR mEdIum bROwN cOLOR pATTERN.

Discussion. ThIs spEcIEs wAs dEscRIbEd bAsEd ON A sERIEs Of ONLy fOuR spEcImENs fROm ThE sOuThERN UNITEd STATEs . LA RIvERs (1951) INdIcATEd ThAT ThE fEmALE ALLOTypE ANd TwO mORE pARATypEs wERE dEpOsITEd IN ThE R. L. UsINGER cOLLEcTION. ThE ALLOTypE Is cuRRENTLy hOusEd AT ThE EMEC , whEREAs ThE OThER TwO pARATypEs ARE IN ThE cOLLEcTION Of ThE USNM . ThE spEcImEN dEsIGNATEd by UsINGER As ThE hOLOTypE bORE A LAbEL ORIGINALLy IdENTIfyING ThE spEcImEN As
Ambrysus mexicanus
MONTANdON. BEcAusE ThIs spEcImEN hAd bEEN IdENTIfIEd by J. R. dE LA TORRE- BuENO, UsINGER NAmEd ThE spEcIEs AfTER hIm. EvEN ThOuGh LA RIvERs (1951) ExAmINEd A mALE spEcImEN (NOw AT EMEC ) ANd pROvIdEd ThE chARAcTERIsTIcs Of ThE AGP , hE dId NOT ILLusTRATE ThE sTRucTuRE IN hIs wORK ON ThE
Ambrysus Of
MExIcO
(LA RIvERs 1953A). IT wAs IN ANOThER sTudy (LA RIvERs 1953b ) IN whIch hE ILLusTRATEd ThE AGP bAsEd ON A LARGE sERIEs Of spEcImENs cOLLEcTEd IN FORT DAvIs, TExAs .

SOmE spEcImENs Of
A. buenoi
cAN pREsENT A fAINT dENdRITIc pATTERN ON ThE cORIum ANd cLAvus Of ThE hEmELyTRA, sImILAR TO ThE cLEARLy vIsIbLE pATTERN ON ThE scuTELLum
Of A. californicus
; hOwEvER, ThIs pATTERN Is NOT pREsENT ON ThE scuTELLum Of
A. buenoi
.

Variation. SOmETImEs mALE spEcImENs pREsENT ThE psEudOpARAmEREs TApEREd TO A ROuNdEd ApIcAL LObE. ThE scuTELLum cAN bE mORE dARKLy cOLOREd OR ExhIbIT A hETEROGENEOus pATTERN Of bROwN TONEs ( FIG. 1A ).

Type locality.
UNITEd STATEs : TExAs : BREwsTER CO., RIO GRANdE
.
Repository. HOLOTypE Is hOusEd AT ThE USNM.

Distribution. IN ThE UNITEd STATEs , ThIs spEcIEs Is dIsTRIbuTEd IN sOuThERN
NEw
MExIcO
ANd wEsTERN TExAs , IN ThE fAR sOuThEAsTERN AREA Of ThE BAsIN ANd RANGE physIOGRAphIc pROvINcE. IN
MExIcO
, ThIs spEcIEs Is dIsTRIbuTEd IN NORThwEsTERN ChIhuAhuA (sOuThERN ExTENsION Of ThE BAsIN ANd RANGE physIOGRAphIc pROvINcE), IN ThE MExIcAN PLATEAu bIOGEOGRAphIc pROvINcE ( FIG. 2 ). LA RIvERs (1951) REpORTEd ThIs spEcIEs fROm SAN ANTONIO IN
MExIcO
bAsEd ON A mALE spEcImEN AT EMEC , buT NO INfORmATION AbOuT ThE sTATE wAs GIvEN ON ThE spEcImEN LAbEL; ThEREfORE, NO spEcIfIc LOcALITy wAs pROvIdEd. DAvIs (1996) REpORTEd ThE sAmE spEcImEN, buT hE AscRIbEd SAN ANTONIO TO ThE sTATE Of SONORA , IN ThE sOuThERN muNIcIpALITy Of ÁLAmOs. ThIs sITE Is cONsIdERAbLy sEpARATEd fROm ThE U.S. LOcALITIEs whERE
A. buenoi
hAs bEEN cOLLEcTEd; Thus, wE cONsIdER ThIs A mIsINTERpRETATION Of ThE LOcALITy dETAILs by DAvIs (1996) . WE ExAmINEd ThE sAmE spEcImEN REpORTEd by LA RIvERs ANd DAvIs ANd ALsO fOuNd ANOThER spEcImEN wITh ThE sAmE INcOmpLETE INfORmATION duRING A vIsIT TO ThE CALIfORNIA AcAdEmy Of ScIENcEs. ThERE Is A SAN ANTONIO TOwN IN ThE MExIcAN sTATE Of ChIhuAhuA , IN ThE NORThEAsTERN muNIcIpALITy Of MANuEL BENAvIdEs. ThIs TOwN Is LOcATEd LEss ThAN 10 KILOmETERs sOuTh Of ThE bORdER wITh ThE UNITEd STATEs , sOuTh Of ThE BIG BENd NATIONAL PARK IN TExAs , whERE ThE spEcIEs hAs cOmmONLy bEEN cOLLEcTEd. BAsEd ON ThIs INfORmATION, wE cONsIdER IT mORE pLAusIbLE ThAT ThIs SAN ANTONIO TOwN Is whERE ThE spEcIEs wAs ORIGINALLy cOLLEcTEd IN
MExIcO
, whIch wAs AcTuALLy pREvIOusLy REpORTEd As ThE TypE LOcALITy Of
A. hungerfordi
UsINGER ( UsINGER 1946 ). ThE REcORds hEREIN pREsENTEd fROm ThE sTATE Of ChIhuAhuA REpREsENT ThE fIRsT spEcIfIc dIsTRIbuTION dATA Of
A. buenoi
IN
MExIcO
.

Ambrysus buenoi
wAs cOLLEcTEd syNTOpIcALLy wITh
A. pulchellus IN Eddy
COuNTy, NEw MExIcO ( 10-III-1989 ).
Published records. UNITEd STATEs: NEw MExIcO, TExAs; MéxIcO: SONORA ( UsINGER 1946 ; DE CARLO 1950 ; LA RIvERs 1951 , 1953A, 1971; DAvIs 1996 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Structures of
Ambrysus buenoi
. (A) dorsal habitus of male, (B) 6th and 7th abdominal terga of male, (C) 8th abdominal tergum of male, (D) ventral surface of phallosoma, (E) left side of phallososma, (F) sternum VI and subgenital plate of female (terminal abdominal segments removed; arrow indicates posterior margin of laterosternite VI). agp = accessory genitalic process, al = apical lobe, ldf = left dorsal flap, lvl = left ventral lobe, mc = medial convexity, plc = posterolateral corner, pp = pseudoparamere, sct = scutellum, sgp = subgenital plate. Size bar = 0.5 mm and applies only to figures D and E.
